nodes.name: queryItems

challengeRequest(bytes32,string).details: Challenges the latest request of a item. Accepts enough ETH to fund a potential dispute considering the current required amount. Reimburses unused ETH. TRUSTED.

params._evidence: A link to an evidence using its URI. Ignored if not provided or if not enough funds were provided to create a dispute.
params._itemID: The ID of the item with the request to challenge.

executeRequest(bytes32).details: Executes a request if the challenge period passed and no one challenged the request.

params._item: The item with the request to execute.

isPermitted(bytes32).details: Return true if the item is on the list.

params._itemID: The ID of the item to be queried.

isPermitted(bytes32).return: allowed True if the item is allowed, false otherwise.

queryItems(bytes32,uint256,bool[8],bool,.details: Return the values of the items the query finds. This function is O(n), where n is the number of items. This could exceed the gas limit, therefore this function should only be used for interface display and not by other contracts.

params._count: The number of items to return.
params._cursor: The ID of the items from which to start iterating. To start from either the oldest or newest item.
params._filter: The filter to use. Each element of the array in sequence means: - Include absent items in result. - Include registered items in result. - Include items with registration requests that are not disputed in result. - Include items with clearing requests that are not disputed in result. - Include disputed items with registration requests in result. - Include disputed items with clearing requests in result. - Include items submitted by _party. - Include items challenged by _party.
params._oldestFirst: Whether to sort from oldest to the newest item.
params._party: The address to use if checking for items submitted or challenged by a specific party.

queryItems(bytes32,uint256,bool[8],bool,.return: The values of the tokens found and whether there are more tokens for the current filter and sort.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Give a ruling for a dispute. Can only be called by the arbitrator. TRUSTED. Overrides parent function to account for the situation where the winner loses a case due to paying less appeal fees than expected.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

withdrawFeesAndRewards(address,bytes32,u.details: Reimburses contributions if no disputes were raised. If a dispute was raised, sends the fee stake rewards and reimbursements proportional to the contributions made to the winner of a dispute.

params._beneficiary: The address that made contributions to a request.
params._itemID: The ID of the item with the request from which to withdraw.
params._request: The request from which to withdraw.
params._round: The round from which to withdraw.
